results.title: ‘You Just Think About Eating’: Why Tunisians Backed a Presidential Power Grab
results.abstract: Dissatisfied by the government’s handling of the pandemic and the economy, some in this North African nation welcomed drastic action to change the political leadership.
des_facet: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

results.title: 9-Year-Old’s Death in Delhi Renews Protests Against Sexual Violence
results.abstract: Her family accuses four men of raping her, then killing her and quickly cremating the body to hide evidence. Demonstrators in the capital say it still happens all too often.

results.title: In Photos: Fires Ravage Southern Europe
results.abstract: From the Greek islands to southern Turkey, extreme heat and dry conditions are driving devastating wildfires that have killed people and threatened homes, ancient heritage sites and tourist havens.
results.byline: By Niki Kitsantonis and Megan Specia

multimedia.caption: Firefighters tried to extinguish a blaze on Tuesday in the yard of a house in the Dekelia-Tatoi forest, outside Athens.

results.title: Biden defers deportations of Hong Kong residents in the U.S.
results.abstract: President Biden said there were “compelling foreign policy reasons” for the order, which would give any resident of Hong Kong targeted for deportation an 18-month reprieve.

results.title: Is Iran’s Supreme Leader Truly Supreme? Yes, but President Is No Mere Figurehead
results.abstract: Iran’s government is neither the democracy it claims nor the monolithic theocracy portrayed by critics. The new president, inaugurated Thursday, has real powers but is subservient to an “ultimate authority.”

results.title: Turks Wage War on Social Media as Raging Fires Turn Political
results.abstract: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has come under a concerted attack by his opponents over his handling of the worst forest fires in decades.

multimedia.caption: Men herding cows away from an advancing fire on Monday in the city of Mugla, Turkey.
